answers.answer: I was not familiar with ALA's, but looked them up online after reading your question.  It certainly sounds like a miracle drug for diabetics and almost anyone.  Supposedly it is a powerful antioxidant and helps to prevent the complications of diabetes.  I would love to hear more if any of you have ever actually used this supplement and experienced some of the se benefits.  Sorry I don't have more info. Good luck in your Ph.D. program.ES

Mayo Clinic has reported some research findings based on a study in Russia where ALA was shown to ease diabetic neuropathy.  At least at the time the article was written, the IV-formulation used in that study was not available in US.The article is a bit dated (April2003) but might shed some light.http://www.defeatdiabetes.org/Articles/neuropathy030416.htmI'm cautious about jumping on a supplement bandwagon, and when I think I've read enuf about something to want to try it, I run the idea by my physician.
